intro: Ibatia selloana, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its dense, dark wood that is highly valued in the musical instrument industry. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in racemes, often blooming in spring.
